intro: Amphipogon laguroides subsp. havelii, commonly known as the Havel’s spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are modified inflorescences typical of the spurge family. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
